cli_manifest_no_artifacts: The specified manifest '%(name)s' did not contain any artifacts.
cli_save_manifest_failure: An error occurred when trying to save the manifest: %(err)s.
cli_invalid_url_option: The specified API URL is not valid.
cli_invalid_path_option: The --path option is only supported for web assets, content assets, content types, layouts, layout mappings, and pages.
cli_invalid_siteContext_option: The --site-context option is only supported for sites and pages.
cli_ready_and_manifest_options: The --ready and --manifest options cannot both be specified.
cli_draft_and_manifest_options: The --draft and --manifest options cannot both be specified.
cli_help_on_commands: For help on specific commands use wchtools <command> -h

cli_update_notifier_changelog: A new version of wchtools exists. See %(changelog_url)s for a list of changes.
cli_manifest_and_server_manifest: The --manifest and --server-manifest options cannot both be specified.
cli_deletions_manifest_saved: The deletions manifest was written to %(filename)s
cli_found_credentials: Found credentials for the API URL %(url)s: %(username)s.
cli_error_loading_credentials: The credentials for the API URL %(url)s could not be loaded: %(err)s.
cli_login_successful: Successfully authenticated user %(username)s for API URL %(url)s.
cli_opt_verbose: Display verbose results from the specified operations.
cli_opt_url: The API URL specific to your %(product_name)s tenant. You can find this URL in the hub information dialog of the %(product_name)s authoring user interface.
cli_opt_invalid_dir: The specified directory %(dir)s could not be created.
cli_pull_complete_nothing_pulled: No items pulled, nothing modified on the server.  Use the -I option to ignore timestamps, if you want to pull unmodified server artifacts
cli_pull_complete_ignore_timestamps_noth: No items to be pulled. Pull complete
cli_pull_manifest_and_deletions: Deletions cannot be determined when pulling items by manifest. Specify either --manifest or --deletions, but not both.
cli_write_deletions_manifest_and_deletio: A deletions manifest can only be written when the --deletions options is also specified.
cli_pull_pulling_pages: Pulling page definitions for the default site
cli_pull_description: Pull modified authoring artifacts from the IBM Watson Content Hub. By default if no artifact types are specified, web assets will be used as the default.
cli_pull_opt_types: If specified, content types will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_assets: If specified, content assets will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_web_assets: If specified, web assets will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_image_profiles: If specified, image profiles will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_content: If specified, content will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_default_content: If specified, default content will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_renditions: If specified, renditions will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_categories: If specified, categories will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_site_revisions: If specified, publishing site revisions will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_sites: If specified, site definitions will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_pages: If specified, page definitions will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_ignore_timestamps: If specified, pull artifacts whether or not they have been modified since the last successful pull or push command.
cli_pull_opt_deletions: If specified, pull artifacts whether or not they have been modified, and delete any local artifacts that do not exist on the server.
cli_pull_opt_quiet: If specified, do not confirm deletions.
cli_pull_opt_path: If specified, only artifacts that are in this relative path will be pulled. For example, if /mySPA is specified, all artifacts under the mySPA folder would be pulled. If /mySPA/test is specified, only artifacts under the /mySPA/test folder will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_siteContext: If specified, page and site artifacts will only be pulled for the site with the specified context root. For example, if 'store' is specified, page and site artifacts will be limited to the site with that context root. The default site does not have a context root, so 'default' can be specified.
cli_pull_opt_use_manifest: Pull only the items listed in the specified manifest file loaded from the local working directory.
cli_pull_opt_use_server_manifest: Pull only the items listed in the specified manifest loaded from the IBM Watson Content Hub.
cli_pull_opt_write_manifest: Write the set of pulled artifacts to the specified manifest file.
cli_pull_opt_write_deletions_manifest: Write the set of deleted artifacts to the specified deletions manifest file. Only valid with the --deletions option.
cli_pull_opt_all: If specified, pull all types of authoring artifacts.
cli_pull_opt_dir: Local working directory for storing files pulled from the Watson Content Hub authoring services.
cli_pull_opt_by_type_name: If specified with -A or --all-authoring, then pull the type, content directly associated with the specified type name, and assets directly referenced by that content.  This option implicitly sets the ignore timestamp option and is not for use with the --deletions option.
cli_pull_opt_bytype_deletions: The --deletions option may not be specified with the --by-type-name option.
cli_pull_opt_bytype_artifacts: Invalid artifact type specified for the --by-type-name option.  The --by-type-name option should only be specified with -A or --all-authoring options, and will pull all content, assets, and renditions directly associated with the specified type.
cli_pull_opt_by_type_all: The --by-type-name option supports pulling all content, assets, and renditions, directly associated with the specified type. It must be specified with the -A or --all-authoring options to indicate all artifact types supported by the current version of this option.
cli_pull_opt_ready: If specified, pull ready artifacts. (This is the default.)

cli_pull_type_references: The type %(name)s has a reference element.  Type references to another content type are not followed when pulling by type, so this pull operation may not retrieve all artifacts associated with the specified type.
cli_push_complete_nothing_pushed: No items pushed, nothing has been modified locally since the last successful push or pull command.  Use the -I option to ignore timestamps, if you want to push both modified and unmodified artifacts
cli_push_complete_ignore_timestamps_noth: No items to be pushed, push complete.
cli_push_no_directories_exist: The path specified does not contain any directories or items to be pushed. Verify the path being used.
cli_push_pushing_pages: Pushing page definitions for the default site
cli_push_description: Push modified authoring artifacts to the IBM Watson Content Hub. If no artifact types are specified, web assets will be pushed by default.
cli_push_opt_types: If specified, content types will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_assets: If specified, content assets will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_web_assets: If specified, web application assets will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_image_profiles: If specified, image profiles will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_content: If specified, content will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_default_content: If specified, default content will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_categories: If specified, categories and taxonomies will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_renditions: If specified, renditions will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_site_revisions: If specified, publishing site revisions will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_sites: If specified, site definitions will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_pages: If specified, page definitions will be pushed
cli_push_opt_ignore_timestamps: If specified, pushes artifacts whether or not they have been modified since the last successful pull or push command.
cli_push_opt_use_manifest: Push only the items listed in the specified manifest file loaded from the local working directory.
cli_push_opt_use_server_manifest: Push only the items listed in the specified manifest loaded from the IBM Watson Content Hub.
cli_push_opt_write_manifest: Write the set of pushed artifacts to the specified manifest file.
cli_push_opt_all: If specified, push all types of authoring artifacts.
cli_push_opt_dir: Local working directory for storing files to be pushed to the Watson Content Hub authoring services.
cli_push_opt_path: If specified, only artifacts that are in this relative path will be pushed. For example, if /mySPA is specified, all artifacts under the mySPA folder would be pushed. If /mySPA/test is specified, only artifacts under the /mySPA/test folder will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_siteContext: If specified, page and site artifacts will only be pushed for the site with the specified context root. For example, if 'store' is specified, page and site artifacts will be limited to the site with that context root. The default site does not have a context root, so 'default' can be specified.
cli_push_opt_named: If specified, only the item of the requested type with this name will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_force_override: If specified, force an override of revision conflicts, when pushing authoring artifacts. This option is ignored for publishing artifacts, which don't allow override of revision conflicts.
cli_push_opt_create_only: If specified, only attempt to create artifacts on push, do not attempt to update first.  The default if not specified, is to attempt an update of each artifact and to fall back to create if an artifact doesn't exist yet on the server.
cli_push_opt_ready: If specified, push ready artifacts. (This is the default.)
cli_push_opt_publish_now: If specified, push assets and content with an option to override a publishing schedule and publish these artifacts immediately. This option is only applicable to ready content and assets.
cli_push_opt_set_tag: If specified, set the specified tag on any assets, types, and content, being pushed.

cli_listing_pages: Listing page definitions for the default site
cli_list_description: List local artifacts modified since they were pulled from or pushed to the server. If no artifact types are specified, web assets will be listed by default.
cli_list_opt_types: If specified, content types will be listed.
cli_list_opt_assets: If specified, assets will be listed.
cli_list_opt_web_assets: If specified, web assets will be listed.
cli_list_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be listed.
cli_list_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be listed.
cli_list_opt_image_profiles: If specified, image profiles will be listed.
cli_list_opt_content: If specified, content will be listed.
cli_list_opt_default_content: If specified, default content will be listed.
cli_list_opt_categories: If specified, categories will be listed.
cli_list_opt_renditions: If specified, renditions will be listed.
cli_list_opt_site_revisions: If specified, publishing site revisions will be listed.
cli_list_opt_sites: If specified, site definitions will be listed.
cli_list_opt_pages: If specified, page definitions will be listed.
cli_list_opt_all: If specified, list all types of authoring artifacts.
cli_list_opt_write_manifest: Write the set of listed artifacts to the specified manifest file. (implies -I)
cli_list_opt_path: If specified, only artifacts that are in this relative path will be listed. For example, if /mySPA is specified, only artifacts under the mySPA folder would be listed. If /mySPA/test is specified, only artifacts under the mySPA/test folder will be listed.
cli_list_opt_siteContext: If specified, page and site artifacts will only be listed for the site with the specified context root. For example, if 'store' is specified, page and site artifacts will be limited to the site with that context root. The default site does not have a context root, so 'default' can be specified.
cli_list_opt_ignore_timestamps: If specified, all local artifacts will be listed whether or not they have been modified since the last successful push or pull command.
cli_list_opt_new: If specified, new local artifacts will be listed
cli_list_opt_deleted: If specified, deleted local artifacts will be listed
cli_list_opt_modified: If specified, modified local artifacts will be listed.  This is the default option if no other status option, such as new or deleted, is specified.
cli_list_opt_server: If specified, artifacts will be listed based on whether they have been modified or deleted on the server since the last successful push or pull command.
cli_list_opt_ready: If specified, list ready artifacts. (This is the default.)
cli_rendering_description: Render all ready content.  This command will also cause existing published content to be re-published.
cli_rendering_opt_rebuild: Delete content items from delivery and republish them.  This implicitly triggers a re-rendering of all your content.  A rebuild ignores global publish schedules and the auto publish flag.
cli_publishing_description: Publish all ready artifacts that have not automatically been published.
cli_publishing_opt_rebuild: Delete all artifacts from delivery and republish them.  A rebuild ignores global publish schedules and the auto publish flag.
cli_publishing_opt_status: Display the current state of the publishing site revision.  Use of an optional id has been deprecated, and will be ignored if specified.
cli_publishing_job_error: Publish request resulted in an error: %(message)s
cli_publishing_site_revision_error: Unable to retrieve the publishing site revision. %(message)s
cli_delete_description: Delete the specified artifact(s) from Watson Content Hub. Only remote artifacts will be deleted. Use local operating system commands to delete artifacts from the file system after deleting them from Watson Content Hub.
cli_delete_opt_assets: If specified, content assets will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_web_assets: If specified, web assets will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_image_profiles: If specified, image profiles will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_content: If specified, content will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_default_content: If specified, default content will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_types: If specified, content types will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_categories: If specified, categories and taxonomies will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_sites: If specified, site definitions will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_pages: If specified, page definitions will be deleted. You can delete all pages, or by path or id. Note that child pages will also be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_page_content: If specified, content associated with the page will be deleted when deleting a page.  This option is only valid when deleting pages.
cli_delete_opt_all_authoring: If specified, all types of authoring artifacts will be deleted.  This option may only specified if either the --all or --tag option is also specified.
cli_delete_opt_use_manifest: Delete only the items listed in the specified manifest file loaded from the local working directory.
cli_delete_opt_use_server_manifest: Delete only the items listed in the specified manifest loaded from the IBM Watson Content Hub.
cli_delete_opt_name: The name of the artifact(s) to be deleted. Note that some artifact types allow multiple instances to have the same name.
cli_delete_opt_all_artifacts: If specified, all artifacts of the specified type(s) will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_id: The id of the artifact to be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_tag: If specified, then delete content items, content types, or content assets with the specified tag.
cli_delete_opt_path: The path to the artifact(s) to be deleted. To specify a folder of artifacts that should be deleted, you must also specify -r or --recursive
cli_delete_opt_siteContext: If specified, page and site artifacts will only be deleted for the site with the specified context root. For example, if 'store' is specified, page and site artifacts will be limited to the site with that context root. The default site does not have a context root, so 'default' can be specified.
cli_delete_opt_recursive: If specified, the --path option will be treated as a folder, and all artifacts within that folder will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_preview: If specified, list the artifact(s) that would be deleted, but do not actually delete the artifact(s).
cli_delete_opt_quiet: If specified, do not confirm deletion. (When more than one artifact would be deleted, a confirmation is displayed for each one.)
cli_delete_opt_by_type_name: If specified with -c, then delete the content item(s) associated with the specified type name.
cli_delete_opt_ready: If specified, delete ready artifacts. (This is the default.)
cli_delete_only_one_type: Deleting more than one artifact type at a time is only supported when the --all, --tag, or --manifest option is specified.
cli_delete_no_type: An artifact type must be specified.
cli_delete_no_id_or_path: To delete a layout or layout mapping, the --id or --path option must be specified. To delete all layouts or layout mappings, the --all option must be specified.
cli_delete_both_id_and_path: The --id and --path options cannot both be specified.
cli_delete_id_ready_draft: The --ready and --draft options cannot both be specified when deleting by id.
cli_delete_path_required: To delete a web asset (or a folder of web assets), the --path option must be specified. To delete all web assets, the --all option must be specified.
cli_delete_siteContext_required: To delete a site definition, the --site-context option must be specified. To delete all site definitions, the --all option must be specified.
cli_delete_requires_id_or_path_and_siteC: To delete a page, the --id option or the --path and --site-context options must be specified. To delete all pages for a specific site, the --all and --site-context options must be specified. To delete all pages, the --all option must be specified.
cli_delete_path_tag_required: To delete a content asset, the --path or --tag option must be specified. To delete all content assets, the --all option must be specified.
cli_delete_requires_id_name: To delete a content type, the --id, --named, or --tag option must be specified. To delete all content types, the --all option must be specified.
cli_delete_requires_id_name_bytypename: To delete a content item, the --id, --named, --tag, or --by-type-name option must be specified. To delete all content items, the --all option must be specified.
cli_delete_by_id_not_supported: The --id option is not supported for the specified artifact type.
cli_delete_by_path_not_supported: The --path option is not supported for the specified artifact type.
cli_delete_by_tag_not_supported: The --tag option is only supported for content items, content types, and content assets.
cli_delete_recursive_not_supported: The --recursive option is not supported for the specified artifact type.
cli_delete_page_content_req_pages: The --page-content option is only supported for pages.
cli_deleting_all_pages_for_site: Deleting all page definitions for the %(id)s site
cli_delete_no_match: There are no artifacts that match the specified value.
cli_delete_preview: The following artifacts match the specified value.
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_types: The following content types would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_assets: The following assets would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_image_prof: The following image profiles would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_layouts: The following layouts would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_layout_map: The following layout mappings would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_content: The following content would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_default_co: The following default content would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_categories: The following categories would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_sites: The following sites would be deleted
cli_preview_deleting_manifest_pages: The following pages would be deleted
cli_delete_assets_by_tag_no_match: There are no content assets with a tag that matches "%(tag)s".
cli_delete_content_by_tag_no_match: There are no content items with a tag that matches "%(tag)s".
cli_delete_types_by_tag_no_match: There are no content types with a tag that matches "%(tag)s".
cli_delete_assets_by_tag_preview: Preview of content assets with a tag that matches "%(tag)s"
cli_delete_content_by_tag_preview: Preview of content items with a tag that matches "%(tag)s"
cli_delete_types_by_tag_preview: Preview of content types with a tag that matches "%(tag)s"
cli_delete_types_by_tag: Deleting content types with a tag that matches "%(tag)s"
cli_delete_assets_by_tag: Deleting content assets with a tag that matches "%(tag)s"
cli_delete_content_by_tag: Deleting content items with a tag that matches "%(tag)s"
cli_delete_page_children_confirm: Delete page %(path)s and all of its child pages? y/n
cli_delete_site_pages_confirm: Delete site %(path)s and all of its pages? y/n
cli_delete_all_no_type: At least one artifact type must be specified.
cli_delete_all_no_manifest: A manifest cannot be used when deleting all.
cli_delete_all_no_preview: Delete all does not support the --preview option.
cli_delete_confirm_all: Are you sure you want to delete all artifacts of the specified types? y/n
cli_delete_nothing_deleted: There were no artifacts to be deleted.
cli_delete_error: There was an error deleting artifacts: %(err)s
cli_clear_description: Clear the data associated with the specified option.
cli_opt_clear_cache: Clear the content delivery network (CDN) cache for the specified Watson Content Hub tenant.  This initiates a background task that may take some time for the CDN to complete, and should only be used when necessary.
cli_clear_requires_cache: The clear command currently only supports clearing the content delivery network cache.  Specify the %(cache)s option to clear the cache.
cli_clear_cache_error: The clear command resulted in an error. %(message)s
cli_clear_cache_started: Sending the clear cache request to the specified Watson Content Hub tenant.
cli_clear_cache_successful: The clear cache operation was successfully accepted by Watson Content Hub.

cli_clear_cache_estimate.one: The Watson Content Hub content delivery network estimates that it will take %d second to complete the cache invalidation.
cli_clear_cache_estimate.other: The Watson Content Hub content delivery network estimates that it will take %d seconds to complete the cache invalidation.

cli_clear_cache_details: The clear cache response from the Watson Content Hub API included the following details %(clear_cache_response_details)s
cli_init_opt_user_name: The user name to be saved in the configuration settings.
cli_init_opt_url: The API URL specific to your %(product_name)s tenant. You can find this URL in the hub information dialog of the %(product_name)s authoring user interface.
cli_init_opt_dir: If specified, the location where the configuration settings will be saved. If not specified, the configuration settings will be saved in the user's home directory.
cli_init_opt_retry_max_attempts: The maximum number of attempts if a WCH API request fails due to a network or server too busy error. The default is 5.
cli_init_opt_retry_min_time: The minimum amount of time in milliseconds to wait before attempting to retry a failed WCH API request. The default is 1000.
cli_init_opt_retry_max_time: The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait before attempting to retry a failed WCH API request. The default is 16000.
cli_init_opt_store_credentials: Store the user credentials by API URL in the operating system key manager (Windows or Mac OS). When connecting to Watson Content Hub, if a username and password are not specified as command line arguments, the stored credentials will be retrieved and used for authentication.
cli_init_success: The configuration settings were saved to %(path)s
cli_init_expected_numeric_arg: The %(arg)s option expected a positive numeric value, but received %(argv)s
cli_init_store_creds_success: The user credentials for API URL %(url)s have been stored in the operating system key manager.
cli_init_store_creds_error: An error occurred when trying to store the user credentials for API URL %(url)s in the operating system key manager. %(message)s
cli_init_store_creds_not_supported: The --store-credentials option is not supported on this platform: %(platform)s.
cli_compare_description: Compare two local working directories. If no artifact types are specified, web assets will be compared by default.
cli_compare_opt_types: If specified, content types will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_assets: If specified, assets will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_web_assets: If specified, web assets will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_image_profiles: If specified, image profiles will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_content: If specified, content will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_default_content: If specified, default content will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_categories: If specified, categories will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_renditions: If specified, renditions will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_profiles: If specified, publishing profiles will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_site_revisions: If specified, publishing site revisions will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_sources: If specified, publishing sources will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_sites: If specified, site definitions will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_pages: If specified, page definitions will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_verbose: Display all differences in the compared artifacts to the console.
cli_compare_opt_all: If specified, compare all types of authoring artifacts.
cli_compare_opt_use_manifest: Compare only the items listed in the specified manifest file.
cli_compare_opt_filter_deletions: Filter the deletions written to only the intersection of the supplied manifest and the detected deletions.
cli_compare_opt_write_manifest: Write the set of differences between the artifacts to the specified manifest file.
cli_compare_opt_write_deletions_manifest: Write the set of deleted artifacts to the specified manifest file.
cli_compare_opt_source: Local working directory containing the authoring artifacts or WCH API URL to use as the source for the compare.
cli_compare_opt_target: Local working directory containing the authoring artifacts or WCH API URL to use as the target for the compare.
cli_compare_opt_path: If specified, only artifacts that are in this relative path will be compared.  For example, if /mySPA is specified, only web assets under the mySPA folder would be compared.  If /mySPA/css is specified, only web assets under the mySPA/css folder will be compared.
cli_compare_opt_siteContext: If specified, page and site artifacts will only be compared for the site with the specified context root. For example, if 'store' is specified, page and site artifacts will be limited to the site with that context root. The default site does not have a context root, so 'default' can be specified.
cli_compare_opt_ready: If specified, compare ready artifacts. (This is the default.)
cli_log_non_verbose: See wchtools-cli.log for more information on the operation.
